How do I know if I need custom insoles?: Custom insoles are specially designed to support your feet in the correct neutral position. This is very important for people who overpronate or supine and can help those with recurring foot, ankle or knee pain related to things like plantar fasciitis, Morton's neuroma or runner's knee. Research has shown that proper underfoot support can help prevent overpronation and supination and relieve pain associated with foot, ankle and knee strains and injuries. But you can still benefit from custom insoles without acute foot problems or if you have a neutral foot type! Custom insoles add a perfect, custom fit and all-day comfort to any type of shoe. If you spend several hours of the day on your feet, a custom foot support can help prevent leg and lower back fatigue. A good footrest benefits the entire body's kinetic chain, promoting good alignment of the feet and legs up the entire spine. If you're still unsure or want to learn more about your foot type, it's a good idea to get a foot or gait analysis. They are offered by many sports clubs and many physiotherapists, sports coaches, trainers and doctors..

How to clean the insoles?: To clean, lightly brush or wipe the insoles with a damp cloth. Air out damp insoles at room temperature between uses. Do not machine wash. Do not expose to high heat.
How much do the insoles weigh?: The weight of the insoles is indicative and may vary by approximately + / – two grams due to variations in the cushioning material.
How long do insoles typically last befor: The life of the insole varies depending on the foot type of each person, weight, footwear, activity and intensity of use. As with footwear, insoles last longer if you take a break between uses. Active, continuous or intensive use wears out insoles faster than occasional use.
